channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: VP Harris Wants to Stop Wall Street Homebuying, But Will It Help Regular Buyers?
item.description: Kamala Harris has a plan to make it easier for first-time homebuyers to buy a house, but it comes at the expense of institutional investors. Eviction filings surge throughout the […]

item.title: Opkey, an AI-based ERP testing platform, raises $47M
item.description: Companies are experimenting with services like ChatGPT to help workers write memos, answer questions, and much more, yet one of the clearest signs of how much traction AI is really getting in the world of enterprise IT is how often it figures in the more routine applications that organizations use. Today, a startup that exemplifies […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Prosecutors Fight Exonerations
item.description: As laws are passed to support the wrongfully convicted, some officials in the legal system push back.

item.title: Rentals Cool—Here’s Where Concessions Are Picking Up
item.description: The rental market has been on a downward trajectory for a while, but now a third of landlords are offering concessions.

item.title: Kenyan HR and payroll startup Workpay lands Visa as investor in $5M round
item.description: Workpay provides cloud-based HR, payroll, and benefits solutions for businesses with employees across Africa. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: FAQ: How The Marshall Project Is Covering the 2024 Election
item.description: Learn more about who we are and how we choose what political stories to cover.

item.title: Where We’d Invest in Real Estate in 2024 if We Were Starting from Scratch
item.description: New to real estate investing? In the beginning, you’re drowning in recommendations of where to invest in real estate, especially in 2024. Everyone is shouting different markets at you, “Cleveland! […]

item.title: VC leading Bolt’s hoped-for $450M deal confirms he’s offering ‘marketing credits’
item.description: Ashesh Shah, the founder and CEO of The London Fund is, as you might imagine, bullish on Bolt. The London Fund is a U.K. venture firm with “over $1 billion in cash and assets” in AUM that is leading a proposed $450 million raise for Bolt, a one-click checkout startup that has been embroiled in […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Mother on a Mission for Full Police Transparency
item.description: Troy, Alabama, police severely beat Ulysses Wilkerson when he was 17. Seven years later, his mom, Angela Williams, is still fighting for answers.

item.title: Making $300K+ Profit Per Rental and Scaling FAST with “DADUs”
item.description: Making a $300,000 profit from ONE rental?! Imagine how quickly you could reach financial freedom by raking in this amount of profit and reinvesting it into your real estate portfolio. […]

item.title: Bolt’s Breslow faces uphill battle with proposed cramdown
item.description: Bolt’s aggressive ultimatum to its existing shareholders will be an expensive uphill battle, an expert familiar with Bolt’s corporate charter tells TechCrunch. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How the 1968 DNC in Chicago Devolved into ‘Unrestrained and Indiscriminate Police Violence’
item.description: As protesters prepare for the Democratic National Convention in Chicago next week, a half-century old report provides lessons for preventing chaos.

item.title: Commercial Brokerage JLL Takes $18 Million Loss In Loan Fraud Scheme
item.description: DOJ investigators discovered a multiyear scheme regarding fraudulent loans that led to an $18 million loss for JLL.

item.title: This new accessible Xbox nunchuk controller has 3D-printable joystick parts
item.description: Microsoft demonstrated its leadership in accessible gaming hardware again on Wednesday with the announcement of a new one-handed joystick controller for Xbox and PC. The Xbox Adaptive Joystick works with the company’s already robust accessibility hardware stack, and even includes support for custom 3D-printed parts. The Adaptive series of devices and controllers has been around […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Aaron Sankin is The Marshall Project’s new Deputy Data Editor
item.description: Sankin brings deep experience with ambitious data projects.
